properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged heat event will begin today. A hot and humid airmass is forecast to return to the Windsor and Chatham area this week. Maximum daytime temperatures of 31 degrees are possible with overnight minimum temperatures likely remaining near 21 degrees providing little relief from the heat. Scattered showers and thunderstorms are possible each day which could prevent maximum daytime highs reaching 31 degrees. However, maximum humidex values are still expected to be near 40. The hot and humid conditions are expected to remain in the area until the weekend. A cold front is expected to move through on Saturday and bring cooler conditions to the area. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T00:39:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T08:40:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4042281573.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T05:23:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T13:23:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3416089071.2019
Area: Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall possible today and tonight. Rain currently affecting the southwest coast of Newfoundland will spread eastward along the coast throughout the day today. We are generally expecting between 20 and 40 mm by Tuesday morning. However, due to some isolated pockets of heavier rain, totals could reach as high as 60 mm over some areas. It should be more clear later today which areas, if any, will be affected by heavier rain. Until then, the public is advised to be prepared for heavy downpours, especially with regards to travel or outdoor activities for Canada Day. Rain is expected to taper to showers and drizzle by Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-07-01T21:17:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T13:18:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1204367835.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Clarenville and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
